</li>
<li class="pillars__item">
<a class="pillar-link" href="https://www.theguardian.com/uk/lifeandstyle" data-link-name="amp : nav : Lifestyle">
Lifestyle
</a>
</li>
</ul>

<span class="veggie-burger__icon"></span>
<span class="u-h">Menu</span>
</button>
</nav>
</header>

<div class="l-side-margins">
<article id="article" data-test-id="article-root" class="content content--article content--pillar-news section-uk-news tonal tonal--tone-news" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/NewsArticle" role="main">
<meta itemprop="mainEntityOfPage" content="https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/mar/19/spy-poisoning-skripals-salisbury-uk-must-prove-russian-involvement-or-apologise-kremlin">
<div itemprop="publisher" itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/Organization">
<meta itemprop="name" content="The Guardian">
<div itemprop="logo" itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/ImageObject">
<meta itemprop="url" content="https://uploads.guim.co.uk/2018/01/31/TheGuardian_AMP.png">
<meta itemprop="width" content="190">
<meta itemprop="height" content="60">
</div>
</div>
<header class="content__head tonal__head tonal__head--tone-news
    
    ">
<div class="content__header tonal__header">
<div class="gs-container">
<div class="content__main-column u-cf">
<div class="content__labels content__labels--not-immersive
">
</div>
<h1 class="content__headline" itemprop="headline">
UK must prove Russian role in spy poisoning or apologise, Kremlin says
</h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="tonal__standfirst u-cf">
<div class="gs-container">
<div class="content__main-column">
<div class="content__standfirst" data-link-name="standfirst" data-component="standfirst">
<meta itemprop="description" content="Moscow demands proof as EU foreign ministers call for Russia to cooperate in novichok inquiry"/>
<p>Moscow demands proof as EU foreign ministers call for Russia to cooperate in novichok inquiry</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</header>
<div class="content__main tonal__main tonal__main--tone-news">
<div class="gs-container">
<div class="content__main-column content__main-column--article js-content-main-column ">
<div class="js-score"></div>
<div class="js-sport-tabs football-tabs content__mobile-full-width"></div>
<figure itemprop="associatedMedia image" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject" data-component="image" class="media-primary media-content ()  " data-media-id="efbc1b19444feea4e8a41d161b29691775f8177c" id="img-1">
<meta itemprop="representativeOfPage" content="true">

<meta itemprop="width" content="3500">
<meta itemprop="height" content="2101">
<amp-img src="https://i.guim.co.uk/img/media/efbc1b19444feea4e8a41d161b29691775f8177c/0_19_3500_2101/master/3500.jpg?w=620&amp;q=55&amp;auto=format&amp;usm=12&amp;fit=max&amp;s=7b35eff36d77d2d4f545f0099317212c" layout="responsive" width="3500" height="2101" class="maxed responsive-img" itemprop="contentUrl" alt="A police notice on boards surrounding a restaurant in Salisbury visited by former Russian spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter before their collapse on 4 March."></amp-img>

</svg>
</span>

</figcaption>

<div class="meta__contact-wrap">

<p class="content__dateline" aria-hidden="true">
<time itemprop="datePublished" datetime='2018-03-19T12:30:38+0000' data-timestamp="1521462638000" class="content__dateline-wpd js-wpd">

</a>
</li>
<li class="social__item social__item--messenger social--hidden social__secondary" data-link-name="messenger">
<a class="social__action js-social__action--top social-icon-wrapper" data-link-name="social top" href="fb-messenger://share?link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Fuk-news%2F2018%2Fmar%2F19%2Fspy-poisoning-skripals-salisbury-uk-must-prove-russian-involvement-or-apologise-kremlin%3FCMP%3Dshare_btn_me&amp;app_id=180444840287" target="_blank" title="Messenger">
<span class=' u-h '>Share on Messenger</span>
<span class="inline-share-messenger inline-icon rounded-icon centered-icon social-icon social-icon--messenger">
<svg width="66" height="66" viewbox="-12 -12 90 90" class="rounded-icon__svg centered-icon__svg social-icon__svg social-icon--messenger__svg inline-share-messenger__svg inline-icon__svg">
<path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M33 61.1c-3.6 0-7.1-.5-10.4-1.5L10.1 66V52.5C3.9 47 0 39.2 0 30.6 0 13.7 14.8 0 33 0s33 13.7 33 30.6c0 16.8-14.8 30.5-33 30.5zM36.5 41L28 32.2l-16.4 9 18-18.9 8.5 8.8 16.4-9-18 18.9z"/>
</svg>
</span>
</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="content__article-body from-content-api js-article__body" itemprop="articleBody" data-test-id="article-review-body">
<p>The Kremlin has insisted the UK must prove Russia’s role in the poisoning of a former spy or apologise, as the EU called on Moscow to provide “full and complete disclosure of its novichok programme” to international experts. <br tabindex="-1"></p>
<p>The demands for proof came as a team of international experts began a <a href="http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-43453833" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">visit to Porton Down in Wiltshire</a> on Monday to assess the nerve agent used to poison Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia. Experts from the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) were invited by the UK to verify the nerve agent, but it will take at least two weeks before they have results.</p>
<p>During a meeting of 28 European foreign ministers in Brussels, the EU issued a statement expressing “unqualified solidarity with the UK”. But they stopped short of threatening new sanctions against <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/russia" data-link-name="auto-linked-tag" data-component="auto-linked-tag" class="u-underline">Russia</a> and avoided pinning the blame on the Kremlin.</p>
<div class="amp-ad-container">
<amp-ad width="300" height="250" type="doubleclick" data-loading-strategy="prefer-viewability-over-views" json="{&quot;targeting&quot;:{&quot;ct&quot;:&quot;article&quot;,&quot;co&quot;:&quot;jennifer-rankin&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/uk-news/2018/mar/19/spy-poisoning-skripals-salisbury-uk-must-prove-russian-involvement-or-apologise-kremlin&quot;,&quot;su&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;edition&quot;:&quot;int&quot;,&quot;tn&quot;:&quot;news&quot;,&quot;p&quot;:&quot;amp&quot;,&quot;k&quot;:&quot;politics,uk/uk,eu,world,europe-news,russia,sergei-skripal,foreignpolicy&quot;,&quot;sh&quot;:&quot;https://gu.com/p/8a295&quot;}}" data-slot="/59666047/theguardian.com/uk-news/article/amp">
</amp-ad>
</div>
<p> The bloc said it took “extremely seriously the UK government’s assessment that it is highly likely that Russia was responsible”. This did not go as far as an earlier joint statement by France, Germany, the US and UK, <a draggable="true" href="https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/mar/15/salisbury-poisoning-uk-us-germany-and-france-issue-joint-statement" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">which concluded</a> it was “highly likely that Russia was responsible for the attack”. </p>
<p>The EU called on Russia “to address urgently the questions raised by the UK and the international community and to provide immediate, full and complete disclosure of its novichok programme to the OPCW. The use of chemical weapons by anyone under any circumstances is completely unacceptable and constitutes a security threat to us all.” </p>
<p>The EU statement came as Russia demanded proof it was behind the Salisbury attack. “Sooner or later these unsubstantiated allegations will have to be answered for: either backed up with the appropriate evidence or apologised for,” Vladimir Putin’s spokesman said on Monday.</p>
<p>Boris Johnson welcomed the EU’s “unqualified solidarity”, having condemned Moscow’s “increasingly absurd” denials, citing its contradictory claims about Russian production of novichok.</p>
<p>“What people can see is that this is a classic Russian strategy of trying to conceal the needle of truth in a haystack of lies and obfuscation.”</p>
<aside class="element element-rich-link element--thumbnail element-rich-link--not-upgraded" data-component="rich-link" data-link-name="rich-link-1 | 1">
<p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/mar/17/sergei-skripal-russia-expels-23-british-diplomats" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">Sergei Skripal: Russia expels 23 UK diplomats as row deepens</a> </p>
</aside>
<p>The foreign secretary said many EU countries had been victims of “malign Russian behaviour” and that Moscow was “not fooling anybody any more”.<br></p>
<p>Theresa May and EU leaders are expected to discuss the attack at a summit in Brussels on Thursday night.</p>
<div class="amp-ad-container">
<amp-ad width="300" height="250" type="doubleclick" data-loading-strategy="prefer-viewability-over-views" json="{&quot;targeting&quot;:{&quot;ct&quot;:&quot;article&quot;,&quot;co&quot;:&quot;jennifer-rankin&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/uk-news/2018/mar/19/spy-poisoning-skripals-salisbury-uk-must-prove-russian-involvement-or-apologise-kremlin&quot;,&quot;su&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;edition&quot;:&quot;int&quot;,&quot;tn&quot;:&quot;news&quot;,&quot;p&quot;:&quot;amp&quot;,&quot;k&quot;:&quot;politics,uk/uk,eu,world,europe-news,russia,sergei-skripal,foreignpolicy&quot;,&quot;sh&quot;:&quot;https://gu.com/p/8a295&quot;}}" data-slot="/59666047/theguardian.com/uk-news/article/amp">
</amp-ad>
</div>
<p>The EU’s decision not to rush to sanctions was not a surprise, as several ministers had expressed the need for more evidence. <br></p>
<p>Spain’s Alfonso Dastis said: “We think now the time is for an extended examination of all the elements involved, with the participation of the OPCW.” Belgium’s foreign minister, Didier Reynders, said it was necessary to put pressure on Russia to take part in a proper inquiry.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, the Swedish foreign minister dismissed Russian claims that Sweden was the source of the nerve agent as “ridiculous and totally unfounded”. Margot Wallström said Russia was “trying to make some kind of diversion from the real issues”.</p>
<p>Germany’s foreign minister, Heiko Maas, said Russia would remain a difficult partner for the EU, and questioned the fairness of Sunday’s presidential elections, which <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/mar/19/vladimir-putin-secures-record-win-in-russian-presidential-election" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">Putin won by a landslide</a>.</p>
<p>The Kremlin’s demand for proof from the UK came in response to a question about whether the exacerbation of tensions with the west had boosted Putin’s performance.<br></p>
<div class="amp-ad-container">
<amp-ad width="300" height="250" type="doubleclick" data-loading-strategy="prefer-viewability-over-views" json="{&quot;targeting&quot;:{&quot;ct&quot;:&quot;article&quot;,&quot;co&quot;:&quot;jennifer-rankin&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/uk-news/2018/mar/19/spy-poisoning-skripals-salisbury-uk-must-prove-russian-involvement-or-apologise-kremlin&quot;,&quot;su&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;edition&quot;:&quot;int&quot;,&quot;tn&quot;:&quot;news&quot;,&quot;p&quot;:&quot;amp&quot;,&quot;k&quot;:&quot;politics,uk/uk,eu,world,europe-news,russia,sergei-skripal,foreignpolicy&quot;,&quot;sh&quot;:&quot;https://gu.com/p/8a295&quot;}}" data-slot="/59666047/theguardian.com/uk-news/article/amp">
</amp-ad>
</div>
<p>Dmitry Peskov said: “I wouldn’t use the phrase ‘exacerbation of tensions with the west’. It’s a question of this stream of slander, that is hard to explain and difficult to understand the motivation for, from the British side towards Russia.”</p>
<p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/mar/18/vladimir-putin-nonsense-to-think-russia-would-poison-spy-in-uk" data-link-name="in body link" class="u-underline">Putin had rejected as “nonsense”</a> allegations that Russia was behind the attack on the Skripals, which also left a British police officer seriously ill.</p>
<p>Speaking to Emmanuel Macron by phone, Putin said the allegations were unsubstantiated. In a statement on Putin’s return to the Kremlin, the French president avoided congratulating his Russian counterpart directly. Instead, Macron wished success to the Russian people in the modernisation of politics, democracy, as well as economic and social fronts. </p>
</div>
<div class="submeta">
<span class="submeta__label">Topics</span>
<div class="submeta__section-labels">

</a>
</li>

</div>

<path d="M22.09 7.87a9.9 9.9 0 0 0-7.05-2.92c-5.49 0-9.96 4.47-9.96 9.96 0 1.75.46 3.47 1.33 4.98L5 25.04l5.28-1.38c1.45.79 3.09 1.21 4.76 1.21 5.49 0 9.96-4.47 9.96-9.96a9.92 9.92 0 0 0-2.91-7.04m-7.05 15.32c-1.49 0-2.95-.4-4.22-1.15l-.3-.18-3.13.82.84-3.05-.2-.31a8.19 8.19 0 0 1-1.26-4.41c0-4.56 3.71-8.27 8.28-8.27 2.21 0 4.29.86 5.85 2.43a8.222 8.222 0 0 1 2.42 5.85c0 4.56-3.72 8.27-8.28 8.27m4.54-6.2c-.25-.12-1.47-.73-1.7-.81s-.39-.12-.56.12c-.17.25-.64.81-.79.97-.14.17-.29.19-.54.06-.25-.12-1.05-.39-2-1.23a7.283 7.283 0 0 1-1.38-1.72c-.15-.25-.02-.38.11-.51.11-.11.25-.29.37-.44.12-.15.17-.25.25-.42.08-.17.04-.31-.02-.44-.06-.12-.56-1.35-.77-1.85-.2-.49-.41-.42-.56-.43-.14-.01-.31-.01-.48-.01-.17 0-.44.06-.66.31-.22.25-.87.85-.87 2.08 0 1.22.89 2.41 1.02 2.57.12.17 1.75 2.68 4.25 3.76.59.26 1.06.41 1.42.52.6.19 1.14.16 1.57.1.48-.07 1.47-.6 1.68-1.18s.21-1.08.14-1.18c-.06-.08-.23-.14-.48-.27"/>
</svg>
</span>
</a>
</li>
<li class="social__item social__item--messenger " data-link-name="messenger">
<a class="social__action js-social__action--bottom social-icon-wrapper" data-link-name="social bottom" href="fb-messenger://share?link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Fuk-news%2F2018%2Fmar%2F19%2Fspy-poisoning-skripals-salisbury-uk-must-prove-russian-involvement-or-apologise-kremlin%3FCMP%3Dshare_btn_me&amp;app_id=180444840287" target="_blank" title="Messenger">
<span class=' u-h '>Share on Messenger</span>
<span class="inline-share-messenger inline-icon rounded-icon centered-icon social-icon social-icon--messenger">
<svg width="66" height="66" viewbox="-12 -12 90 90" class="rounded-icon__svg centered-icon__svg social-icon__svg social-icon--messenger__svg inline-share-messenger__svg inline-icon__svg">
<path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M33 61.1c-3.6 0-7.1-.5-10.4-1.5L10.1 66V52.5C3.9 47 0 39.2 0 30.6 0 13.7 14.8 0 33 0s33 13.7 33 30.6c0 16.8-14.8 30.5-33 30.5zM36.5 41L28 32.2l-16.4 9 18-18.9 8.5 8.8 16.4-9-18 18.9z"/>
</svg>
</span>
</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>

<div class="fc-container__header__title">
<span>more on this story</span>
</div>
<div class="fc-item tone-news">
<div class="fc-item__image-container">
<amp-img src="https://i.guim.co.uk/img/media/3887f494ebf7ec5a70a9af4e4aacc97822e99689/0_36_1647_989/500.jpg?q=55&amp;auto=format&amp;usm=12&amp;fit=max&amp;s=edb13fc1b3c5d3d1f4c9240d2589b4db" layout="fixed" width=126 height=75></amp-img>
</div>
<div class="fc-item__content">
<div class="fc-item__header">
<h2 class="fc-item__title">
<span>
</span>
Russian oligarch in London fatalistic about his safety from attack
</h2>
</div>
<aside class="fc-item__meta">
<time class="fc-item__timestamp" data-relativeformat="short">
</time>
</aside>
</div>

<li class="colophon__item"><a data-link-name="international : footer : work for us" href="https://workforus.theguardian.com">
work for us</a>
</li>
<li class="colophon__item"><a data-link-name="international : footer : contact us" href="https://www.theguardian.com/help/contact-us">
contact us</a>
</li>

complaints &amp; corrections</a>
</li>
</ul>
